H0.text: The boy and girl inherit genetic material from the father only when twins are born, one being a boy and the other a girl.

H1.text: The boy and girl, who are twins born, inherit genetic material from the mother only.

H2.text: The boy and girl inherit genetic material from both parents.

H3.text: The boy inherits genetic material from the father only and the girl inherits it from the mother only in a pair of twins born, one boy and one girl.

A4.text: Autosomal dominant inheritance means a single copy—inherited from either parent—is enough to cause this trait to appear.

A5.text: Mitochondria are inherited from one's mother.

A6.text: Inheritance through the maternal line (in case of mitochondrial DNA loci)

A7.text: Autosomal – loci are not situated on a sex chromosome
